titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Katherine "Kitty" Minehart was the director of the Germantown Theatre Guild. She was married to the actor and writer Dan Lounsbery, who died in 1993. In 1963, the Germantown Theatre Guild staged a production of "Alice," a dramatic adaptation of Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland. This production sparked Minehart's interest in Lewis Carroll and his characters, particularly Alice.

scopecontent.p: This collection of Alice in Wonderland ephemera falls into two basic segments: theatrical adaptations of the Alice story and the use of images and themes from the story in media (advertising, greeting cards, cartoons, newspaper articles). The theater-related ephemera includes playbills, announcements, newspaper and magazine clippings of reviews and advertisements, posters, and a copy of Eva le Galienne's annotated script for her adaptation of "Alice in Wonderland." Other ephemera includes clippings, cartoons, advertisements, greeting cards, auction catalogs, magazines, announcements and catalogs for exhibitions, and programs and announcements from the Lewis Carroll Society of North America. The collection also includes several books, including a memorial tribute to Charles Dodgson, parodies of Alice in Wonderland and adaptations of the story.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
